Other candidate super PACs have also spent their own share of funds on negative ads, but have failed to move the needle enough to get within striking distance of the former president â€” opting to target each other instead.

Never Back Down, the main DeSantis-backing super PAC, has spent just over $350,000 against Trump â€” and $4.5 million on ads targeting 2024 rival Nikki Haley, according to Pyersâ€™ data. Another pro-DeSantis super PAC, Fight Right Inc., has specifically targeted Haley with over $1.7 million in negative ads.

Haleyâ€™s super PAC, SFA Fund Inc., has targeted DeSantis with over $4.9 million worth of spending as the ad wars between the two expand.

4 Trump continues to not engage with the rest of the GOP field in debates and is riding off his high polling numbers. AP

In total spending, the DeSantis campaign and its backers have spent $50.8 million, Haleyâ€™s campaign and her backers have spent $39.1 million and MAGA Inc. and the Trump campaign have spent $38.3 million, according to data from AdImpact.

â€œWhile other groups have lit donor money on fire in their pointless competition for first loser, MAGA Inc. has effectively supported the re-election of President Trump, who is leading in every poll by historic margins,â€ spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt told The Post. â€œWe will continue to be thoughtful stewards of the investments made into MAGA Inc. and accomplish our ultimate goal of winning back the White House next November.â€

Title: Philippines says Chinese coast guard fired water cannons against its ships delivering supplies off disputed shoal
Content(RAW):
MANILA, Philippines â€” The Chinese coast guard targeted Philippine vessels with water cannon blasts Sunday and rammed one of them, causing damage and endangering Filipino crew members off a disputed shoal in the South China Sea, just a day after similar hostilities at another contested shoal, Philippine officials said.

The Philippines and its treaty ally, the United States, immediately condemned the latest confrontation near the Second Thomas Shoal, where two Philippine navy-operated supply boats and two Philippine coast guard escort ships had sailed to deliver food and other supplies to Filipino forces in a long-marooned navy ship that serves as a territorial outpost.

â€œWe condemn, once again, Chinaâ€™s latest unprovoked acts of coercion and dangerous maneuvers against a legitimate and routine Philippine rotation and resupply mission to Ayungin Shoal that has put the lives of our people at risk,â€ a Philippine government task force that deals with the territorial disputes said in a statement, using the Filipino name for the shoal.

The Chinese coast guardâ€™s high-pressure water cannon blasts disabled and severely damaged the engines of the Philippine supply boat M/L Kalayaan, which had to be towed back to the western Philippine province of Palawan, Philippine officials said, adding the action seriously endangered the lives of the crew.

One of two Philippine coast guard escort ships, the BRP Cabra, sustained damage to its mast due to the water cannon blast.

Another supply boat was rammed by a Chinese coast guard ship but still managed to maneuver away and deliver supplies to Filipino marines at Second Thomas Shoal, they said.

4 The Chinese Coast Guard targeted Philippine vessels with water cannon blasts near a disputed shoal in the South China Sea on Dec. 10, 2023. Philippine Coast Guard via AP

Drone video footage and photographs issued by the Philippine coast guard show two Chinese coast guard ships separately blasting water cannons at close range at BRP Cabra and a smaller supply boat.

â€œThe systematic and consistent manner in which the Peopleâ€™s Republic of China carries out these illegal and irresponsible actions puts into question and significant doubt the sincerity of its calls for peaceful dialogue,â€ it said. â€œWe demand that China demonstrate that it is a responsible and trustworthy member of the international community.â€

The Chinese coast guard said it had â€œimplemented controls in accordance with laws and regulations.â€ The statement gave no details about the measures taken but said the Philippines action â€œseriously infringed on Chinaâ€™s sovereignty.â€

4 The Chinese Coast Guard ship also rammed a Philippine supply boat. Philippine Coast Guard via AP

It also claimed a Philippine vessel ignored warnings and in violation of international navigation regulations made a sharp turn in an â€œunprofessional and dangerous mannerâ€ and intentionally collided with a Chinese coast guard ship, causing â€œscratching.â€

â€œThe responsibility lies entirely with the Philippine side,â€ the coast guard said.

Coast guard spokesperson Gan Yu described Chinaâ€™s actions as â€œreasonable, legal and professional,â€ and said such operations would continue unabated.

â€œWe sternly warn the Philippines to immediately cease its infringing actions â€¦ and strictly control its provocations on the front line so as not to drop a stone on its own foot,â€ Gan was quoted as saying on the coast guardâ€™s website.

Chinaâ€™s actions were strongly condemned by foreign diplomats in the Philippines, including the ambassadors from treaty partner the U.S., the European Union and Japan.

â€œThe U.S. stands with the Philippines and partners in vehemently condemning the PRCâ€™s repeated illegal and dangerous actions against vessels,â€ U.S. Ambassador MaryKay L. Carlson posted on X, formerly known as Twitter.

Chinaâ€™s ships, which have surrounded the Philippine-occupied Second Thomas Shoal for years, have blocked Philippine coast guard and supply boats in a yearslong effort to take control of the hotly disputed atoll claimed by both nations.

China has rejected all international condemnation and attempts at legal intervention, including a 2016 ruling by a U.N.-backed arbitration tribunal that invalidated Chinaâ€™s claims, leaving them without any legal basis. China insists it has a legal right to â€œdefend its sovereigntyâ€ in keeping with its claim to virtually the entire South China Sea, one of the worldâ€™s most crucial waterways for shipping and other maritime activities.

4 The confrontation took place near the Second Thomas Shoal for a second consecutive day. Philippine Coast Guard via AP

On Saturday, the Chinese coast guard and accompanying ships also trained water cannons at three Philippine fisheries vessels to prevent them from approaching Scarborough Shoal in the disputed waters off the northwestern Philippines.

That caused â€œsignificant damageâ€ to the communication and navigation equipment of one of the three Philippine Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources vessel, Philippine officials said. They added that suspected militia vessels accompanying Chinese coast guard ships used a long-range acoustic device that could impair hearing, causing â€œsevere temporary discomfort and incapacitation to some Filipino crew.â€

In other high seas clashes this year, Chinese coast guard ships used a military-grade laser that caused Filipino crewmen temporary blindness and engaged in dangerous blocking and shadowing maneuvers that caused minor collisions, Philippines officials say.

4 A Chinese Coast Guard ship ramming the Philippine navy-operated supply boat Unaizah Mae 1. Philippine Coast Guard via AP

More tensions loom.

â€œThe Philippines will not be deterred from exercising our legal rights over our maritime zones,â€ the Philippine government task force said.

A flotilla of 40 civilian fishing boats, backed by Philippine coast guard escort ships, initially was en route Sunday to Second Thomas Shoal but decided to proceed first to two Philippine-occupied islets in the South China Sea to deliver Christmas food packs.

From there, organizers will reassess before the flotilla proceeds with a plan to sail along the vicinity of the Second Thomas Shoal, said one of the organizers, Rafaela David, who denounced the latest Chinese action.

Title: VA Dem featured in streamed sex acts online says sheâ€™s the victim: â€˜Entire life was rockedâ€™
Content(RAW):
A Virginia Democrat who was featured in more than a dozen video streams of her and her husband having sex online for â€œtipsâ€ is speaking out, claiming to be a victim of an invasion of privacy by Republican operatives.

In a recent interview with Politico, former Virginia House of Delegates candidate Susanna Gibson spoke about how she felt about the explicit videos surfacing ahead of her election loss earlier this year.

â€œIt is a feeling that I would not wish on my worst enemy,â€ the Democrat, nurse practitioner and mother of two, told the outlet.

Gibson made waves in September after archived livestream videos of her having sex with her husband resurfaced and circulated online.

The Washington Post broke the story, reporting that the couple solicited payments from viewers in exchange for specific acts.

The Post headlined the story: â€œVa. Dem. House candidate performed sex online with husband for tips.â€

Gibson and her husband were featured in more than a dozen videos that were archived on a site called Chaturbate in September 2022, which is after she officially entered the race for delegate, and the most recent videos were archived on Sept. 30, 2022.

Once news broke and Republican operatives shared the story ahead of election day, Gibson insisted that she was the victim of â€œan illegal invasion of my privacy designed to humiliate me and my family.â€

She continued to stay in the race, until she lost.

3 Former Virginia House of Delegates candidate Susanna Gibson said she victim of an invasion of privacy by Republican operatives after livestream videos of her and her husband having sex online surfaced. AP Photo/Steve Helber

3 Gibson said her entire life was â€œrockedâ€ after the initial Washington Post article was published.

In her recent interview with Politico, Gibson maintained that she was the victim of a media hit job and illegal distribution scheme of the videos.

Mentioning the Postâ€™s story from September, she said, â€œMy entire life was rocked on Sept. 11, when the article ran. It ran, implying that I performed sex acts online with my husband for money. It was really written based on this Dropbox file that self-described Republican operatives shopped around.â€

Gibson spoke to Politico about feeling blindsided: â€œThey had found these videos on the dark web and shopped them around to various news outlets. I didnâ€™t have any idea that there were ever videos of me that had been made and uploaded to multiple sites,â€ she said.

3 Gibson remained in the race, but lost the election. AP Photo/Steve Helber

Gibson added, â€œWhen you find out that there are sexually explicit videos of you online, especially by being contacted by national reporters â€” it is a feeling that I would not wish on my worst enemy.â€

As far as her claims of the videos being spread illegally, she said, â€œContent that is initially made in a consensual context, which is then distributed in a non-consensual context digitally, is a crime.â€

Speaking of her actions versus Republicans spreading info about her explicit content, she opined, â€œChoosing to share content, online or in whatever medium, with select people with the understanding that it will disappear and can only be seen by those present at the time â€” when weâ€™re talking live streaming, webcamming and Skype â€” that is a far cry from consenting for that content to be recorded and then broadly disseminated. And there is case law precedent confirming this.â€

She also told the outlet, â€œI think what people do in their private lives, digitally â€” if it is legal, it is consensual and has no bearing on their ability to do their jobs â€” I think there should be a barrier. I think that it is unethical to make peopleâ€™s private lives â€” especially their sexual private lives â€” public and part of how we think about them and their ability to do their jobs and make positive contributions to their communities.â€

Gibson also warned that other women will soon be victims of the same sort of scrutiny, saying, â€œI think this is going to continue to happen as millennials age into running for office. There was a 2014 study conducted by McAfee that said or showed that 90 percent of millennial women have taken nude photos at some point.â€

Title: Elon Musk restores X account of conspiracy theorist Alex Jones after user poll
Content(RAW):
Elon Musk has restored the X account of conspiracy theorist Alex Jones, pointing to a poll on the social media platform formerly known as Twitter that came out in favor of the Infowars host who repeatedly called the 2012 Sandy Hook school shooting a hoax.

It poses new uncertainty for advertisers, who have fled X over concerns about hate speech appearing alongside their ads, and is the latest divisive public personality to get back their banned account.

Musk posted a poll on Saturday asking if Jones should be reinstated, with the results showing 70% of those who responded in favor. Early Sunday, Musk tweeted, â€œThe people have spoken and so it shall be.â€

A few hours later, Jonesâ€™ posts were visible again and he retweeted a post about his video game. He and his Infowars show had been permanently banned in 2018 for abusive behavior.

Musk, who has described himself as a free speech absolutist, said the move was about protecting those rights. In response to a user who posted that â€œpermanent account bans are antithetical to free speech,â€ Musk wrote, â€œI find it hard to disagree with this point.â€

The billionaire Tesla CEO also tweeted itâ€™s likely that Community Notes â€” Xâ€™s crowd-sourced fact-checking service â€” â€œwill respond rapidly to any AJ post that needs correction.â€

Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones had his account reinstated on X. REUTERS/Mike Segar/File Photo

It is a major turnaround for Musk, who previously said he wouldnâ€™t let Jones back on the platform despite repeated calls to do so. Last year, Musk pointed to the death of his first-born child and tweeted, â€œI have no mercy for anyone who would use the deaths of children for gain, politics or fame.â€

Jones repeatedly has said on his show that the 2012 shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut, that killed 20 children and six educators never happened and was staged in an effort to tighten gun laws.

Relatives of many of the victims sued Jones in Connecticut and Texas, winning nearly $1.5 billion in judgments against him. In October, a judge ruled that Jones could not use bankruptcy protection to avoid paying more than $1.1 billon of that debt.

Musk put up a poll on X asking followers if Jones should have his account back. AP Photo/Kirsty Wigglesworth, Pool, File

Relatives of the school shooting victims testified at the trials about being harassed and threatened by Jonesâ€™ believers, who sent threats and even confronted the grieving families in person, accusing them of being â€œcrisis actorsâ€ whose children never existed.

Jones is appealing the judgments, saying he didnâ€™t get fair trials and his speech was protected by the First Amendment.

Restoring Jonesâ€™ account comes as Musk has seen a slew of big brands, including Disney and IBM, stop advertising on X after a report by liberal advocacy group Media Matters said ads were appearing alongside pro-Nazi content and white nationalist posts.

They also were scared away after Musk himself endorsed an antisemitic conspiracy theory in response to a post on X.

The Tesla CEO later apologized and visited Israel, where he toured a kibbutz attacked by Hamas militants and held talks with top Israeli leaders.

But he also has said advertisers are engaging in â€œblackmailâ€ and, using a profanity, essentially told them to go away.

â€œDonâ€™t advertise,â€ Musk said in an on-stage interview late last month at The New York Times DealBook Summit.

After buying Twitter last year, Musk said he was granting â€œamnestyâ€ for suspended accounts and has since reinstated former President Donald Trump; Ye, the rapper formerly known as Kanye West, following two suspensions over antisemitic posts last year; and far-right Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, who was kicked off the platform for violating its COVID-19 misinformation policies.

Trump, who was banned for encouraging the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol insurrection, has his own social media site, Truth Social, and has only tweeted once since being allowed back on X.

Title: Mitt Romney opposes Biden impeachment probe while ripping Hunter as â€˜unsavory personâ€™
Content(RAW):
Sen. Mitt Romney (R-Ut.) on Sunday came out in opposition to the House GOP-led impeachment inquiry into President Biden â€” while blasting first son Hunter Bidenâ€™s behavior and ripping him as an â€œunsavory person.â€

Romney, who voted to convict then-President Donald Trump during both of his impeachments, argued that there isnâ€™t evidence to go after Joe Biden.

â€œI think before you begin that impeachment inquiry, you ought to have some evidence â€” some inclination that thereâ€™s been wrongdoing,â€ Romney said on NBCâ€™s â€œMeet the Press.â€

â€œIf I was in the House, Iâ€™d vote against it, unless they were able to bring forward evidence that suggests that there were a high crime or misdemeanor that had been committed, but so far, that hasnâ€™t been the case,â€ Romney said.

The Utah senator, who announced he wonâ€™t see reelection in 2024, contended that Hunterâ€™s conduct isnâ€™t enough to go after the president.

â€œFortunately, for most people, weâ€™re not responsible for the misdeeds of our kids and grandkids,â€ Romney said. â€œWeâ€™re not going to impeach somebody because of the sins of their kids.â€

4 Mitt Romney broke with House Republicans on the impeachment probe. @MeetThePress / NBC

House Republicans opened the inquiry into the president back in September under then-Speaker Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.)

That probe was not formally authorized via a House floor vote, but Republicans have signaled their intention of making the inquiry official soon.

Due to the lack of a floor vote, the White House has panned the probe as â€œunconstitutional.â€

Meanwhile, the three-committee inquiry has slapped key players, such as the presidentâ€™s brother James Biden and son Hunter Biden, with subpoenas.

James Biden missed the deadline for testimony last week.

4 House Republicans have accused the president of letting his family sell access abroad. Michael Brochstein/SOPA Images/Shutterstock

Republicans have demanded Hunter Biden appear this Wednesday and have threatened to hold him in contempt if he does not.

The first sonâ€™s lawyer offered to make a public appearance, but Republicans slapped down that offer, pushing for a closed-doors hearing.

Hunter Biden was hit with nine tax-related charges â€” three felonies and six misdemeanors â€” last Thursday, an indictment that came on top of the three gun raps to which heâ€™s pleaded not guilty.

White House spokesperson Ian Sams amplified Romneyâ€™s remarks, reposting a clip of the interview on X â€” while claiming something â€œsinisterâ€ was at play and accusing Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) and her kindred spirits of being a driving force behind the impeachment inquiry.

4 The Utah senator broke from fellow anti-Trumper Liz Cheney. @MeetThePress / NBC

â€œI think itâ€™s easy to sort of laugh and chuckle at this bungling exorcise by House Republicans trying to impeach the president over nothing,â€ Sams told MSNBC on Sunday.

â€œThey want to overturn what happened in 2020 and theyâ€™re using their power to launch these baseless political attacks against the president,â€ he added. â€œMarjorie Taylor Greene and that same far-right faction are starting to come at him (House Speaker Mike Johnson).â€

Romney, during the â€œMeet the Pressâ€ segment, also broke from former Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.), who has opined that Trump, 77, would refuse to leave office should he be granted a second term in 2024.

â€œI donâ€™t think Donald Trump would want to stay in longer than four years. And the reason I say that is because I think heâ€™s running for retribution,â€ Romney said.

During a speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) earlier this year, Trump vowed to be â€œretributionâ€ for his disciples.

â€œI think he will finish his retribution after four years if heâ€™s elected. I donâ€™t think he particularly likes being around the White House. I think heâ€™d rather be back at Mar-a-Lago,â€ Romney said.

â€œHe wants to show that heâ€™s not a loser, he won. And he wants to go after the people who are tough on him.â€

The senator and former 2012 GOP presidential candidate, cautioned against taking Trumpâ€™s words too seriously, likening him to a â€œhuman gumball machine.â€

â€œA thought or a notion comes in and it comes out of his mouth. Thereâ€™s not a lot of filter that goes on,â€ Romney said. â€œHe just says whatever. I donâ€™t attach an enormous amount of impact to the particular words that come out.â€

Romney also weighed in on the 2024 GOP contest, re-upping his opposition to Trump, but fretted that endorsing someone would be the â€œkiss of death.â€

4 Mitt Romney believes that Donald Trump would only serve a four-year term in office should he win in 2024. Aristide Economopoulos

â€œI think Donald Trump recognized if he went through the debate with Chris Christie, Chris Christie would reveal him for what he was,â€ Romney said.

Trump skipped all four GOP primary debates thus far, citing his colossal lead every poll.

â€œNikki Haley, sheâ€™s rising right now. I think sheâ€™s the only one that has a shot becoming the nominee other than President Trumpâ€” itâ€™s a long shot in her part,â€ he added.

Romney teased that after retiring from the Senate at the end of his term in early 2025, he may go work on helping his wife Annâ€™s efforts on backing neurologic research.

Ann Romney suffers from multiple sclerosis, which impairs the nervous systemâ€™s ability to send certain signals causing ailments such as vision issues and muscle pains.

â€œLife is so fantastic. Itâ€™s so wonderful being alive. And I donâ€™t worry about my next chapter,â€ the senator added.

Title: Harvard, MIT presidents face increased calls to â€˜do the right thingâ€™ after UPennâ€™s Magill resigned over response to antisemitism
Content(RAW):
Former University of Pennsylvania President Liz Magillâ€™s resignation has been met with celebration â€” and calls for the heads of Harvard and MIT to also step down over their failures to condemn antisemitism on campus.

Many saw Magillâ€™s resignation on Saturday as the beginning of woke university presidents facing consequences for failing to condemn student calls for the genocide of Jews â€” though others believed it was a win for the censorship of pro-Palestinian voices.

â€œOne down. Two to go,â€ New York Rep. Elise Stefanik posted on X following Magillâ€™s announcement.

â€œ@Harvard and @MIT, do the right thing,â€ the Republican wrote. â€œThe world is watching.â€

Stefanik, the House GOP conference chair, grilled Magill, alongside alongside Harvard University President Claudine Gay and Massachusetts Institute of Technology President Sally Kornbluth during the tense hearing last week.

She said Magillâ€™s resignation was â€œonly the very beginning of addressing the pervasive rot of antisemitism that has destroyed the most â€˜prestigiousâ€™ higher education institutions in America.â€

Stefanik also warned that Harvard and MIT can now â€œanticipate a robust and comprehensive Congressional investigation of all facets of their institutionsâ€™ negligent perpetration of antisemitism including administrative, faculty, funding and overall leadership and governance.â€

6 Harvard President Claudine Gay also is facing calls to quit. AP

6 MIT President Sally Kornbluth also is a target of critics after her testimony before Congress. AP

The organization StopAntisemitism called Magillâ€™s resignation â€œgreat news.â€

It said her ouster came after Magill allowed â€œthe once prestigious university to fall into a chaotic cesspool of Jew hatred this past year.â€

Stay on top of news out of the Israel-Hamas war and the global surge in antisemitism with The Postâ€™s Israel War Update, delivered right to your inbox every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

â€œLetâ€™s hope Harvardâ€™s President Gay is next,â€ StopAntisemitism posted on X.

Billionaire Bill Ackman, who has called for Magill, Gay and Kornbluthâ€™s resignations, celebrated the news of Magill stepping down by saying that â€œmorality has spoken.â€

He previously said there is â€œhope for UPennâ€ if Magill resigns.

6 University of Pennsylvania President Liz Magill resigned on Saturday following her disastrous Congressional testimony. AP

Billboard trucks calling for Gay to be fired were seen circling the Massachusetts campus on Sunday.

The privately-funded trucks read â€œFIRE GAYâ€ and were accompanied by photos of Gay during her appearance before Congress, according to Fox News.

The three university presidents, during the hearing, repeatedly skirted Stefanikâ€™s direct question asking whether â€œcalling for the genocide of Jewsâ€ would violate their schoolsâ€™ codes of conduct.

Magill infamously replied that â€œit is a context-dependent decision.â€

Gay apologized for her remarks in an interview with school newspaper The Harvard Crimson on Thursday, and said she had the support of the Harvard Corporation, which had not publicly commented on the calls for her resignation.

It and the schoolâ€™s Board of Overseers â€” Harvardâ€™s governing bodies â€” convened Sunday to discuss Gayâ€™s leadership, the backlash to her testimony and whether the university should issue a public statement, according to the Crimson.

The executive committee of the MIT Corporation, meanwhile, said Kornbluth had their â€œfull and unreserved supportâ€ in a statement Thursday.

Liyam Chitayat, and Israeli PhD student at MIT, gave an impassioned speech calling out Kornbluth for her comments and the executive board for its response.

â€œSince the executive board responded to this pathetic congressional hearing of our President Sally Kornbluth by stating that they support Sally for her â€˜excellent moral compass,â€™ I have to ask all of you about this continuous obsession with context,â€ Chitayat said in the speech, a video of which was posted online Saturday night.

â€œI want someone to tell me, when is the right context to come and urinate on the window of the prayer room at MIT Hillel in front of the Jewish praying students inside there?â€ said Chitayat, while highlighting some of the antisemitic attacks Jewish students at MIT have recently endured.

â€œTell me when is the right context to respond to reports of students facing blatant antisemitism by telling them, â€˜Well, you can try talking to the police, you can go to therapy or you can go back to where you came from?â€™â€ she continued. â€œI want to know when a dozen students are allowed to storm in and harass individual staff members that work, or are Jewish and are Israeli.â€

6 Rep. Elise Stefanikâ€™s subjected the college heds to repeated questioning. ZUMAPRESS.com

â€œSomehow, thereâ€™s a context in which you can tell Jewish students not to come to the entrance of MIT and go to the back door to their classes,â€ Chitayat, a doctoral student studying computational and systems biology at MIT, added.

â€œThere is context where it makes sense that 70% of Jewish students at MIT do not show any sign that theyâ€™re Jewish because theyâ€™re scared. There is a context where a chaplain advisor is allowed to stop an event four times to say that Israelis are European racists, white colonizers, right before asking who in this room eats kosher.â€

Chitayat went on to say that she sees the faces of some of the Israelis taken hostage by Hamas in those of her own family, and when she looks in the mirror, â€œI see the face of Naama Levy, who was seen being dragged through the streets of Gaza with blood gushing through her thighs.â€

She then turned her attention to Kornbluth and Gay, addressing them both by name as she asked: â€œWhen you look in the mirror what do you see?â€

6 Billionaire Bill Ackman celebrated Magillâ€™s resignation. REUTERS

Others have taken Magillâ€™s resignation and the push for the other school presidents to step down as censorship for pro-Palestine protests, which have persisted on the Pennsylvania campus and others around the US, with protesters chanting, â€œFrom the river to the sea, Palestine will be freeâ€ â€” a chant many claim is calling for the elimination of the Jewish state of Israel.

6 Reporter Alex Kane said the push for Magillâ€™s resignation was â€œnot solelyâ€ about her comments. alexbkane.com

Alex Kane, a reporter with â€œJewish Currentsâ€ magazine claimed that the push for Magillâ€™s resignation is â€œnot solelyâ€ about her, posting that: â€œThe main story is a McCarthyist atmosphere consuming college campuses over calls for Palestinian liberation.

â€œMagill tepidly defended free speech for Palestinian advocates, then made a big PR misstep and fell into a right-wing trap,â€ he claimed.

â€œAl Jazeeraâ€ reporter Laila Al-Arian noted that Magill had been facing criticism for months â€” ever since the university hosted a â€œPalestine Writesâ€ festival, which featured a speaker who called for â€œdeath to Israelâ€ and another who had worn a Nazi-inspired outfit.

â€œThe President of [UPenn] Liz Magill was under attack for months for simply allowing a literary festival called â€˜Palestine Writesâ€™ that featured writers, scholars and artists to take place on campus,â€ Al-Arian wrote. â€œThe efforts to shut down and censor Palestinian voices are relentless.â€

Magill had been under increasing pressure from both donors and lawmakers when the Ivy League school suddenly announced her resignation on Saturday.

Scott L. Bok, chairman of its board of trustees, said both he and Magill had â€œvoluntarilyâ€ resigned their posts, noting Magill would stay on until an interim president was appointed, with a plan for new leadership to be announced in the coming days.

Bok also defended Magill, saying she simply â€œmade a very unfortunate misstep â€” consistent with that of two peer university leaders sitting alongside her â€” after five hours of aggressive questioning before a congressional committee.â€

He went on to praise the ousted president as a â€œvery good person and talented leaderâ€ who â€œis not the slightest bit antisemitic.â€

Bok also claimed Magill was â€œworn down by months of relentless attacksâ€ and â€œprovided a legalistic answer to a moral questionâ€ that â€œmade for a dreadful 30-second sound bite in what was more than five hours of testimony.

â€œFollowing that, it became clear that her position was no longer tenable, and she and I concurrently decided that it was time for her to exit,â€ he said in a statement to The Daily Pennsylvanian.

A source close to situation previously told The Post that the mood was sad Saturday as 27 Penn trustees met for two hours without Magillâ€™s or Bokâ€™s knowledge and decided to recommend that she consider resignation.

The Post has reached out to other board members for their reactions as well.

Jewish leader Julie Platt is now taking over as chairman of the board of trustees until a permanent replacement can be found.

â€œAs current vice chair, Julie was the clear choice for agreeing to serve in this capacity during this time of transition,â€ the executive committee of the Board of Trustees said in a statement to The Daily Pennsylvanian.

In her acceptance, Platt touted her work to end antisemitism on campus

â€œAs vice chair of the universityâ€™s board these past several months, I worked hard from the inside to address the rising issues of antisemitism on campus,â€ Platt said, according to the Jerusalem Post.

â€œUnfortunately, we did not make all the progress that we should have and intended to accomplish.â€

Platt â€” the mother of actor and singer Ben Platt â€” also stressed that she would only serve as an interim chair, as her position as chair of the Board of Trustees for Jewish Federations of North America takes precedence.

â€œAs chair of the Jewish Federation of North America, we are leading the largest mobilization in our history in support of Israelâ€™s right to protect its citizens and against the rise of antisemitism in North America, including staging the largest Jewish rally in American history on the National Mall.

â€œWe will continue this fight with all of our energy.â€

Title: Stefanik takes victory lap as pols cheer the resignation of UPenn president Liz Magill: â€˜One down. Two to goâ€™
Content(RAW):
Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-NY) and other politicians cheered the resignation of University of Pennsylvaniaâ€™s now-former president Liz Magill, who stepped down following disastrous congressional testimony about antisemitism on campus.

â€œOne down. Two to go,â€ said Stefanik, the House GOP conference chair who grilled Magill and the presidents of Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology during the tense hearing last week.

â€œThis is only the very beginning of addressing the pervasive rot of antisemitism that has destroyed the most â€˜prestigiousâ€™ higher education institutions in America,â€ she added in a statement.

Magill announced her resignation Saturday, as did University of Pennsylvania Board of Trustees Chair Scott Bok.

It came after Magill took heat for ducking questions about whether students who chant in favor of genocide against Jews should be punished during congressional hearing Tuesday.

Stefanik pressed Magill and the other university presidents, Claudine Gay, of Harvard, and Sally Kornbluth, of MIT, about student chants, including for â€œintifada,â€ which she noted was a call for â€œthe genocide of Jews.â€

4 Elise Stefanikâ€™s grilling of the university presidents last week quickly went viral. Getty Images

Magill later released an apology and clarified that calls for the genocide of Jews are â€œevil, plain and simple.â€

Other politicians on Sunday blasted Magill and her fellow campus leaders for their responses during the jarring hearing.

â€œAny college president in this country who cannot condemn antisemitism, cannot condemn Jewish genocide, they need to resign or be fired,â€ Rep. Nancy Mace (R-SC) told â€œFox News Sunday.â€

â€œItâ€™s disgusting. Itâ€™s shameful, and it shouldnâ€™t be happening on our college campuses.â€

4 Elizabeth Magill later apologized for her equivocations but opted to resign. The Washington Post via Getty Images

Sen. Mitt Romney (R-Ut.) stressed that he wasnâ€™t going to tell the remaining presidents what to do, but called their responses during that congressional hearing an â€œextraordinary failure.â€

â€œWhat they did in that hearing was absolutely repugnant, was outrageous, incomprehensible. It would have been violated the very premises of American unity,â€ Romney told NBCâ€™s â€œMeet the Pressâ€ on Sunday.

Former House Intelligence Committee Chairman Devin Nunes (R-Calif.), who now helms Trump Media & Technology Group, similarly voiced his astonishment at the hearing.

â€œSeldom do you have a congressional hearing that that results in something happening so quickly,â€ Nunes told â€œSunday Morning Futures.â€

4 Mitt Romney called the presidentsâ€™ comments, â€˜repugnant,â€™ â€˜outrageous,â€™ and â€˜incomprehensible.â€™ Getty Images

â€œI would give the Republicans a lot of credit here that they actually expose what really is stupidity for some of the smartest well known universities around the country,â€ he said.

â€œIâ€™m glad to learn that she will resign,â€ Rep. Josh Gottheimer (D-NJ) simply wrote on X.

â€œUPenn sacked its pathetic President & now faces a harder choice: (1) Expand speech codes to add antisemitism to the list of viewpoints they already ban, OR (2) Embrace true free speech & abandon censorship altogether. #2 would be admirable, but #1 is where theyâ€™ll likely land,â€ presidential hopeful Vivek Ramaswamy said.

Magillâ€™s resignation came in the context of campus donors becoming squeamish amid mounting backlash to her testimony.

During the exchange, Stefanik drilled down on the Ivy Leagy institutionâ€™s policies toward harassment of Jews on campus.

â€œCalling for the genocide of Jews,â€ Stefanik asked during the hearing, â€œdoes that constitute bullying or harassment?â€

4 Vivek Ramaswamy called for campuses to adopt more consistent policies on free speech. AP

â€œIf it is directed and severe, pervasive, it is harassment,â€ Magill responded.

â€œIt is a context-dependent decision, congresswoman,â€ she later added.

â€œThatâ€™s your testimony today? Calling for the genocide of Jews is depending upon the context?â€ Stefanik shot back.

Following the hearing before the House Education and Workforce Committee to examine the prestigious institutionsâ€™ policies toward combating antisemitism on campus, Stefanik demanded the three presidents resign.

Even the White House was seemingly taken aback by the hearing.

â€œItâ€™s unbelievable that this needs to be said: calls for genocide are monstrous and antithetical to everything we represent as a country,â€ Andrew Bates, White House senior communications adviser and deputy press secretary, said in a statement.

The GOP-led paneled chaired by Rep. Virginia Foxx (R-NC) announced Thursday that it will launch a broader investigation into antisemitism on college campuses.

This comes against the backdrop of antisemitic episodes on colleges campuses across the country skyrocketing since the Oct. 7 surprise attack from Hamas.

Title: Two more Jewish hate attacks in as many days in NYC: â€˜It was a real beatingâ€™
Content(RAW):
A Jewish father of five was beaten in front of his own home as his attacker spewed antisemitic vitriol in Brooklyn on Thursday â€” just two days before another man was robbed of his $2,500 traditional Jewish headpiece in the borough as antisemitism continues to rise across New York City.

Joshua Merenfeld, 40, was dressed in Jewish religious garb and enjoying the first night of Hanukkah when an unknown assailant attacked him and snarled, â€œDirty Jewâ€ in the victimâ€™s front yard in Crown Heights.

â€œIt was a real beating,â€ Merenfeld told NBC 4, noting that he was pummeled repeatedly, knocked over and stomped on. â€œDefinitely doesnâ€™t feel good to have this happen in your own front yard.â€

As he was being attacked, Merenfeld said, the assailant â€œused a bunch of antisemitic terminology and profanities.â€

Merenfeld, who now has bruises on his face from the violence, was left on the ground as the suspect snatched his phone and fled.

The masked suspect was later spotted entering the Kingston Avenue and Eastern Parkway subway station.

5 Joshua Merenfeld, a Jewish father of five, was attacked in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, on Thursday. NBC

5 The suspect was seen fleeing to the Kingston Avenue and Eastern Parkway subway station. NYPD

Merenfeld, who received treatment at Mount Sinai Beth Israel hospital, said he was speaking out about the attack given the brazen nature of the assault.

â€œThis is a dangerous person. It didnâ€™t happen at twelve oâ€™clock at night at a back alley somewhere. This happened in front of a well-lit building on Eastern Parkway at seven in the evening,â€ he told NBC.

Then Saturday, the NYPD released video of another antisemitic incident that occurred in Brooklyn when a 20-year-old Hasidic man was robbed in broad daylight.

5 Merenfeldâ€™s jacket bears boot marks from when the assailant stomped on him. NBC

CCTV cameras captured the moment the victim was approached by a man on a moped in the Borough Park neighborhood near the intersection of 53rd Street and 11th Avenue at 2:10 p.m.

The Jewish victim, wearing a $2,500 shtreimel â€“ a traditional fur headpiece worn on the Sabbath â€“ could be seen talking to a man in a black helmet and pink long-sleeved shirt.

After their brief interaction, the victim walks away from the suspect, who revs up his moped and approaches the Jewish man again, grabbing his shtreimel and riding away with it.

The NYPD said both cases are currently under investigation and has asked the publicâ€™s help to identify the suspects in each incident.

5 A Hasidic Jewish man was seen talking to a guy on a moped Saturday in Brooklynâ€™s Borough Park neighborhood. Boro Park Shomrim

5 Moments later, the suspect snatched the victimâ€™s shtreimel, worth $2,500. Boro Park Shomrim

The cases are just the latest in a slew of new antisemitic incidents plaguing New York City, with another case occurring last week when a 66-year-old man was beaten by a male assailant shouting antisemitic bile at a Duane Reade store in Manhattanâ€™s Financial District.

Mayor Eric Adams on Friday addressed the rise in hate crimes during a Hanukkah rally event, noting that the past two months have seen a 250% jump in attacks aimed at the Jewish and Muslim communities. The spike coincides with the ongoing Israel-Hamas war in Gaza.

â€œIn this moment of high tension around the globe, it is more important than ever that we stand together as one, united against the rising tide of hatred and religious intolerance. Weâ€™re seeing it, and weâ€™re feeling it,â€ Adams said at the time.

The mayor noted that the NYPD will remain on high alert throughout the Hanukkah season.

Title: Americans getting tummy tucks in Tijuana plunges thanks to cartel violence
Content(RAW):
The number of Americans getting tummy tucks in Tijuana has plunged this year thanks to fears of local cartel violence and the rising value of the peso against the dollar, a new report says.

The medical tourism trade in the city in Mexico has dropped by more than half, according to industry leaders to Border Report.

â€œThereâ€™s a lot of bad publicity about the city creating a negative perception,â€ said Ricardo Vega Montiel, president of the Plastic Surgeons College of Baja. â€œThe government needs to step up and invest in strategic promotions to generate a better image for the region.â€

Montiel told the outlet that a whopping 3,000 Americans normally get bariatric surgery in Tijuana each month.

That figure has now dipped to fewer than 1,500, he said.

Crime fears exploded earlier this year when four Americans were kidnapped by cartel members in Mexico in March, with two later found dead.

The group had gone south of the border so one of them could get a tummy tuck.

3 Tijuanaâ€™s tummy-tuck industry has plunged this year thanks to everything from crime fears to a dropping dollar. Getty Images

Financial considerations are also playing a role in the drop in business, industry leaders said.

The Mexican peso has been strengthening against the dollar, giving prospective tummy tuckers less of an incentive to cross the border.

The procedure can cost upwards of $20,000 in America â€” and has been known to cost less than half that in Mexico.

The downward trend in Tijuanaâ€™s medical business is also negatively impacting local hotels, restaurants and commercial areas, business leaders said.

Compounding the issue further is the fact that two dozen Tijuana cosmetic procedure clinics are under investigation for possible malpractice, the businessmen told the outlet.

Two people died from bariatric complications in the border town in July, according to reports.

Two of the Americans who traveled to Mexico from Texas in the March group for cosmetic surgery also died, although they were killed by traffickers after likely being mistaken for Haitian drug dealers.

3 The price of a tummy tuck in Mexico can be less than half of the $20,000-plus it costs in the US. Getty Images

Washington McGee, Eric Williams, Shaeed Woodard and Zindell Brown were snatched from their car March 3 en route to a medical clinic in Matamoros.

Woodard and Brown were both killed, while McGee and Williams were eventually freed after being held captive.

McGee was the one seeking the tummy surgery.

3 Roughly 1 million Americans go to Mexico for cheaper medical procedures each year. Getty Images/iStockphoto

Montiel said Tijuana is being unfairly pegged as unsafe and that he expects the cosmetic procedure industry to recover.

Tijuana has long been a popular destination for those seeking out the weight-loss measure â€” with a Facebook group entitled â€œI Left My Stomach in Mexicoâ€ boasting more than 20,000 members.

Roughly 1 million Americans have medical procedures of some kind in Mexico each year.

Title: Videos show wake of destruction after deadly tornado rips through Tennessee
Content(RAW):
Videos shot on Saturday show a tornado making its way through the city of Clarksville, the fifth-largest city in Tennessee.

The footage below captured the moment the dark funnel cloud moves across the horizon, with a neighborhood of standalone homes with vehicles sitting in driveways in the foreground.

Another video showed the tornado forming across from a packed mall parking lot. Buildings are completely dwarfed by the gargantuan gray cloud spinning in the distance.

Below, the tornado was shot moving behind large transmission towers in a field. The texture of the tornado is more apparent in this clip, as the twisterâ€™s powerful winds can be seen spinning around its core.

A traffic cam in Clarksville recorded the supercell that produced the tornado. Footage from the camera showed vehicles driving along the roads as if it were any other day.

The sheriffâ€™s office of Montgomery County, where Clarksville is located, released a statement confirming that a tornado touched down in the area of Hand Estates, a neighborhood in the northwestern part of town. They noted damage had been done to several homes.

The office added that they do not have any confirmed casualties or missing people.

The supercell, along with the tornado, were part of a severe weather system that has been sweeping through the mid-South on Saturday. Prior to reaching Clarksville, the thunderstorm is believed to have spun up at least one other tornado in northwestern Tennessee.

Title: Violence rages through Gaza after US blocks latest push for ceasefire
Content(RAW):
Heavy fighting raged overnight and into Sunday across Gaza, including in the devastated north, as Israel pressed ahead with its offensive after the U.S. blocked the latest international push for a cease-fire and rushed more munitions to its close ally.

Israel has faced rising international outrage and calls for a permanent cease-fire after the killing of thousands of Palestinian civilians. Nearly 85% of Gazaâ€™s 2.3 million people have been displaced within the besieged territory, where U.N. agencies say there is no safe place to flee.

The United States has lent vital support to the offensive once again in recent days, by vetoing United Nations Security Council efforts to end the fighting that enjoyed wide international support, and by pushing through an emergency sale of over $100 million worth of tank ammunition to Israel.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu thanked U.S. President Joe Biden for the â€œimportant ammunition for the continuation of the war,â€ and for supporting Israel at the Security Council.

The U.S. has pledged unwavering support for Israelâ€™s goal of crushing Hamasâ€™ military and governing abilities, and returning all the hostages captured in the Oct. 7 attack that triggered the war.

7 Israelâ€™s president, Benjamin Netanyahu, thanks Joe Biden and the U.S. government for the â€œammunition.â€ AP

Hamas and other Palestinian terrorists stormed into southern Israel that day, killing some 1,200 people and capturing around 240, over 100 of whom were released during a weeklong cease-fire late last month.

In response to the attack, Israel launched an air and ground war that has killed thousands of Palestinians, mostly civilians, and forced some 1.9 million people to flee their homes.

Stay on top of news out of the Israel-Hamas war and the global surge in antisemitism with The Postâ€™s Israel War Update, delivered right to your inbox every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

With only a trickle of aid allowed in, and delivery rendered impossible in much of the territory, Palestinians face severe shortages of food, water and other basic goods.

U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, who invoked a rarely-used power last week to call for a cease-fire, said â€œwe are facing a severe risk of collapse of the humanitarian system.â€

7 The U.S. vetoed the United Nations Security Council efforts to stop the fighting. AP

â€œThe situation is fast deteriorating into a catastrophe with potentially irreversible implications for the Palestinians as a whole and for peace and security in the region,â€ he told a forum in Qatar.

Israelâ€™s national security adviser, Tzachi Hanegbi, told Israelâ€™s Channel 12 TV late Saturday that the U.S. has set no deadline for Israel to achieve its goals of dismantling Hamas and returning all the hostages.

â€œThe evaluation that this canâ€™t be measured in weeks is correct, and Iâ€™m not sure it can be measured in months,â€ he said.

FIGHTING AND ARRESTS IN THE NORTH

7 Palestinians continue to resist, even in the completely decimated neighborhoods of Northern Gaza. AP

Israeli forces continue to face heavy resistance, even in northern Gaza, where entire neighborhoods have been flattened by air strikes and where ground troops have been operating for over six weeks.

Israelâ€™s Channel 13 TV broadcast footage showing dozens of detainees stripped to their underwear with their hands in the air.

Several held assault rifles above their heads, and one man could be seen slowly walking forward and placing a gun on the ground before returning to the group.

Other videos in recent days have shown groups of unarmed men held in similar conditions, without clothes, bound and blindfolded.

Detainees from a separate group who were released Saturday told The Associated Press they had been beaten and denied food and water.

Israel has not commented on the latest video or the allegations of mistreatment, but government spokesman Eylon Levy said â€œincreasing numbersâ€ of Hamas fighters were surrendering and handing over their weapons, calling it a sign of â€œcollapsingâ€ morale.

Residents said there was still heavy fighting underway in the Gaza City neighborhood of Shijaiyah and the Jabaliya refugee camp, a dense urban area housing Palestinian families who fled or were driven out of what is now Israel during the 1948 war surrounding its creation.

7 Some war torn areas cannot be reached by ambulances. AP

â€œThey are attacking anything that moves,â€ said Hamza Abu Fatouh, a resident of Shijaiyah. He said the dead and wounded were left in the streets as ambulances could no longer reach the area, where Israeli snipers and tanks had positioned themselves among the abandoned buildings.

â€œThe resistance also fights back,â€ he added, saying gun battles had raged late Saturday.

Israel ordered the evacuation of the northern third of the territory, including Gaza City, early in the war, but tens of thousands of people have remained there, fearing that the south would be no safer or that they would never be allowed to return to their homes.

Heavy fighting was also underway in and around the southern city of Khan Younis.

WAITING FOR FOOD

7 Due to Israelâ€™s onslaught, Palestinians have to wait for hours for basic necessities. AP

In central Gaza, hundreds of Palestinians waited for flour outside an U.N. distribution center. The price of food has soared as much of the territory faces severe shortages. Abdulsalam al-Majdalawi said he has come every day for nearly two weeks, hoping to get food for his family of seven.

â€œEvery day, we spend five or six hours here and return home (empty handed),â€ he said. â€œThank God, today they drew our name.â€

With the war in its third month, the Palestinian death toll in Gaza has surpassed 17,700, the majority women and children, according to the Health Ministry in the Hamas-controlled territory. The ministry does not differentiate between civilian and combatant deaths.

7 The Palestinian death toll is over 17,000, the majority of victims being women and children. AP

Israel holds Hamas responsible for civilian casualties, saying the terrorists put civilians in danger by fighting in dense, residential neighborhoods.

Israel War Update Get the most important developments in the region, globally and locally. Enter your email address Please provide a valid email address. By clicking above you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. Thanks for signing up!

Never miss a story. Check out more newsletters

The military says 97 Israeli soldiers have died in the ground offensive.

Palestinians terrorists have also continued firing rockets into Israel.

Netanyahuâ€™s office said Sunday that Hamas still has 117 hostages, as well as the remains of 20 people killed in captivity or during the Oct. 7 attack.

The terrorists hope to exchange them for Palestinians imprisoned by Israel.

Israel says it has provided detailed instructions for civilians to evacuate to safer areas, even as it continues to strike what it says are terrorist targets in all parts of the territory. Thousands have fled to the southern town of Rafah and other areas along the border with Egypt in recent days â€” one of the last areas where aid agencies are able to deliver food and water.

The war has raised tensions across the region, with Lebanonâ€™s Hezbollah trading fire with Israel along the border and other Iran-backed terrorist groups targeting the U.S. in Syria and Iraq.

7 Many Palestinians have attempted to flee to Rafah, one of the last areas able to provide food and water. AP

France said one of its warships in the Red Sea shot down two drones that had approached it from Yemen, where Iran-backed Houthi rebels have vowed to halt Israeli shipping through the key waterway.

Hanegbi said Israel has called on its Western allies to address the threat and would give them â€œsome timeâ€ to organize a response. But he said if the threats persist, â€œwe will act to remove this blockade.â€

Title: Donald Trump repeats aspirations to be â€˜dictator for one dayâ€™ at GOP gala in NYC
Content(RAW):
Former President Donald Trump pitched himself as a savior for democracy while repeating his claim that he wants to be a â€œdictator for one dayâ€ during a rowdy speech at a GOP soirÃ©e in New York City.

Last week, Trump made waves the night before the fourth GOP debate, musing that he didnâ€™t plan to be a dictator, â€œexcept for day oneâ€ if elected in 2024.

During his headline address at the 111th annual New York Young Republicans Club Gala, which was filled with jokes and Trumpâ€™s rhetorical greatest hits from the campaign trail, the 45th president revisited the controversy.

â€œ[Peter] Baker today in the New York Times said that I want to be a dictator,â€ Trump complained, referencing a report from the news outlet.

â€œI didnâ€™t say that. I said I want to be a dictator for one day. You know why I wanted to be a dictator? Because I want a wall, and I want to drill, drill, drill,â€ Trump insisted.

4 The 45th president clarified his comments about wanting to be a dictator for one day. AFP via Getty Images

Trump also claimed that the Democratâ€™s â€œnewest hoaxâ€ is to call him a threat to democracy.

The crowed, rife with MAGA stars like Reps. Matt Gaetz (R-Fla.) and Lauren Boebert (R-Col.), applauded him.

Last Tuesday, Trump originally sparked a frenzy about him striving to be a dictator during a town hall with Fox Newsâ€™ Sean Hannity and said he only wanted it on day one.

â€œI want to close the border and I want to drill, drill, drill,â€ Trump said at the time. â€œOther than that, I am not a dictator.â€

His remark drew fierce controversy and came amid frantic warnings from Democrats and disenfranchised Republicans that he aspires to be a tyrant.

His critics have pointed to the Jan. 6, 2021 Capitol riots, Trumpâ€™s 2020 election denials, and fawning over international dictators as evidence.

4 Donald Trump called Democratic characterizations that heâ€™s a threat to democracy, a â€˜hoax.â€™ Aristide Economopoulos

â€œThank God, only one day,â€ President Biden joked at a fundraiser in Los Angeles last week.

â€œSean Hannity actually thought he was helping Trump,â€ Trumpâ€™s ally Steve Bannon complained afterwards. â€œEven to ask that question shows youâ€™re an idiot. And we donâ€™t have time for idiots, bro. This is a war, and we donâ€™t have time for sunshine patriots and this nonsense.â€

At another point in Trumpâ€™s wide-ranging address Saturday, the 77-year-old whined about criticism he gets for calling Chinese leader Xi Jinping â€œbrilliant.â€

â€œHe controls 1.4 billion people with an iron fist. They want me to say heâ€™s just of average intelligence,â€ Trump said. â€œI canâ€™t say bad things.â€

Trump then suggested that strongman Russian President Vladimir Putin is â€œsharp,â€ and gave the same praise to French President Emmanuel Macron.

4 The former president delivered a greatest hits of his campaign trail rhetoric during the gala. AP

In that very same speech, Trump also described himself as a defender of democracy, shrugging off criticism that heâ€™s a threat as â€œmisinformationâ€ and a â€œhoax.â€

Trump, who is facing 91 criminal counts, contended that Biden is the â€œreal threat.â€

â€œThe radical left Democrats, their fake news allies have unveiled their newest hoax that Donald J. And the Republican Party are a threat to democracy,â€ Trump bemoaned.

â€œThis is their new line. Here we go again â€” â€˜Russia, Russia, Russia,â€™ â€˜Mueller, Mueller, Mueller,â€™ â€˜Ukraine, Ukraine, Ukraine.â€™ One hoax after another,â€ he added.

â€œBut no, Iâ€™m not a threat. I will save democracy. The threat is Crooked Joe Biden.â€

Trump is the 2024 GOP frontrunner for the nod to be the party standard bearer in 2024.

4 Donald Trump is the runaway frontrunner in the 2024 GOP primary. Getty Images

He took aim at rival Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, needling that California Gov. Gavin Newsom bested him a debate and taking other jabs.

â€œHe looks like a bobble head doll. I donâ€™t like him because I endorsed him and I got him elected,â€ Trump said.

DeSantisâ€™ campaign generally claims that Trumpâ€™s attacks against the governor come from his fear that the Floridian could defeat him â€” something the Trump campaign rejects.

The Post contacted the DeSantis campaign for comment.

Trump has a whopping 47.6 percentage point lead nationally in the 2024 GOP primary in the latest RealClearPolitics aggregate.

The first GOP contest is slated for Jan. 15, 2024 in the Iowa caucuses.

Title: Mississippi teacher plotted to take student across state lines to elope: report
Content(RAW):
A Mississippi teacher accused of having sex with a student was denied bond after an investigator dropped a disturbing accusation in court.

â€œHe (James Donald Hawkins II) said that they had made plans to go to Louisiana to elope, and things were moving faster than they originally expected,â€ Jackson County Sheriff Captain Kristen Johnson testified, according to WLOX.

Johnson said during her testimony that Hawkins II, 38, had admitted to having sex with the 17-year-old student at his home and in the parking lot of the Ocean Springs Walmart, according to the local news outlet.

Hawkins II, a high school physics teacher in the Ocean Springs school district, was arrested on Nov. 30 and charged with felony sexual battery, according to inmate records.

Law enforcement said that the investigation is ongoing and that more charges could be filed.

â€œThe victim said that it began in the springtime of 2023 before the last school year ended,â€ Johnson told the courtroom during Hawkins IIâ€™s probable cause hearing on Tuesday.

Hawkins II was a high school physics teacher in the Ocean Springs school district. Facebook

â€œAccording to Mr. Hawkins, he admitted they had sex approximately one time a month, including at his house and in her car.â€

Itâ€™s the same home he reportedly lives in with his wife and their toddler, the Sun Herald reported.

The bond was set at $150,000, according to inmate records. The judge also ordered him to stay away from the student and her family.

Hawkins IIâ€™s lawyer, Cameron McCormick, and the school district didnâ€™t immediately return Fox News Digitalâ€™s request for comment, but the school district told local news outlets after his arrest that he had been fired.

School officials said in a statement that the accusations were â€œdisturbing and intolerable.â€

â€œOSSD is deeply troubled by the arrest and charges announced today by the Jackson County Sheriffâ€™s Department involving one of our teachers,â€ the school district said in a statement.

â€œJames Hawkins was terminated from OSSD when district officials were informed of his arrest and subsequent charges by the Jackson County Sheriffâ€™s Department this evening.â€

Title: Person of interest sought after Texas teen Lizbeth Medina found dead in apartment
Content(RAW):
Texas police released chilling images of a person of interest tied to the mysterious death of a 16-year-old Texas cheerleader who was found dead inside her apartment.

The unidentified man who donned a black â€œVolcomâ€ sweatshirt and has a distinctive tattoo behind his right ear, was photographed running, according to surveillance photos.

He was also seen driving a silver Ford Taurus, with model years ranging from 2010 to 2018.

Lizbeth Medina was found unresponsive in the Edna apartment she shared with her mother, Jacqueline, on Dec. 5 after she didnâ€™t show up to a Christmas parade earlier that afternoon.

Edna Police did not specify the suspectâ€™s photographed location in proximity to Medinaâ€™s apartment.

The young Edna High School cheerleader, whose mother said was a â€œloving, kind and big-heartedâ€ girl, was declared dead at the scene.

5 Edna Police did not specify the proximity of where the suspect ran to Medinaâ€™s apartment. Facebook/Edna Police Department

5 The man is believed to be driving a silver Ford Taurus, with model years ranging from 2010 to 2018. Facebook/Edna Police Department

â€œI lost it. She was my world, my everything. Everywhere, everything I do was for her,â€ her mother said.

Circumstances around the teenâ€™s death remain unclear.

â€œWe understand the community wants information in regards to the case, however, we have to keep the integrity of the investigation our number one priority,â€ the department wrote in a post on Facebook.

The Texas Department of Public Safety is assisting Edna police â€œin what investigators believe to be a capital murder,â€ the department said earlier this week.

An autopsy report has yet to be released.

5 Lizbeth Medina was found unresponsive in the Edna apartment she shared with her mother on Dec. 5. ABC 13

The distraught mother of the bright teenager said upon finding her daughter in the bathtub, she â€œrealized she was gone.â€

â€œThere was no laced drugs, there was nothing like that. My daughter was found in a way that no mother should ever find their child,â€ her mother, Jacqueline, said.

â€œWords canâ€™t explain what I felt at that moment finding my daughter in the matter that she was. All I can say is that I hope with all my heart that there is justice for my daughter.â€

5 Her mother grew worried when her daughter did not show up to a Christmas parade earlier that afternoon. Gofundme

5 Circumstances around the teenâ€™s death remain unclear. Liz Medina / Facebook

Edna is home to around 6,000 people and is about 100 miles southwest of Houston.

â€œWe also understand the community is concerned about the individual still being on the loose. Outside agencies are in the area and working with Edna Pd to provide extra patrol,â€ the department wrote.

A vigil was held for Medina Saturday at the Jackson County Courthouse, with attendees wearing white in remembrance of the slain cheerleader.

Title: Holiday shoppers warned of disturbing gift card scam likely padding Chinese bank accounts
Content(RAW):
The Sacramento County Sheriffâ€™s Office is warning the public of a disturbing and â€œvery sophisticatedâ€ gift card scam that has national and international implications.

The sheriffâ€™s office told Fox News Digital this week it carried out a massive anti-retail theft operation at big box stores across the county, netting 285 felony and misdemeanor arrests in seven days.

Among those arrested was a Chinese national who was found to be in possession of thousands of Target and Apple gift cards.

â€œDuring our recent retail theft Operation Bad Elf, detectives observed an individual, later identified as Ningning Sun, acting suspiciously near the gift cards in the payment aisles in a Sacramento Target store,â€ the sheriffâ€™s office said in a press release Wednesday.

The office said investigators witnessed Sun take all the gift cards off a rack in a Target store and put them inside his jacket.

Authorities said the suspect then replaced the missing cards with â€œanother set of seemingly identical ones.â€

Members of the sheriffâ€™s office followed the suspect outside, where recently published footage shows detectives surrounding the man to make an arrest.

4 Ningning Sun was arrested after police saw him acting suspiciously near the gift cards in the payment aisles in a Sacramento Target store. Facebook/Sacramento County Sheriffâ€™s Office

â€œThat guy blew up like a piÃ±ata at a kidâ€™s birthday party, spilling out gift cards from his jacket,â€ Sacramento County Sheriffâ€™s Office spokesperson Amar Gandhi told Fox News Digital in a phone call this week.

After the arrest, detectives made their way to Sunâ€™s car and found thousands of Apple and Target gift cards.

Gandhi explained that the suspect would obtain legitimate gift cards from store shelves and â€œsurgically removeâ€ the glue that covers the cardsâ€™ bar codes.

He would then allegedly record the PINs, re-conceal the bar codes with glue and return the cards to store shelves.

4 Detectives discovered over 5000 gift cards from Target and Apple in his possession. Facebook/Sacramento County Sheriffâ€™s Office

â€œ[The] investigation revealed Sun was part of a scam that tampered with gift cards, scanned the bar code and stole money from the gift card as money was loaded on them. Victims are completely unaware it is happening, and the money is often siphoned to an offshore account within seconds. Their investigation revealed that the operation spanned across California and several regions nationwide,â€ a press release stated.

After the tampered gift cards were returned to shelves, unsuspecting shoppers would then purchase one of the cards and load funds onto it.

The money, however, would immediately transfer to a bank account, in this case likely a Chinese bank account, Gandhi said.

â€œItâ€™s going to go unreported because are you going to confront somebody who gave you a $0 gift card? No, thatâ€™s rude. And then youâ€™re sitting there fat, dumb and happy, thinking, â€˜Oh, I did something nice for somebody,â€™ not knowing that your moneyâ€™s gone,â€ he said.

4 Their investigation revealed Sun was part of a scam that tampered with gift cards, scanned the bar code, and stole money from the gift card as money was loaded on them. Facebook/Sacramento County Sheriffâ€™s Office

The office said it has never seen such a crime before, and that Sun is likely a part of a larger gift card operation.

The sheriffâ€™s office is asking the public to come forward with any tips on the case.

Shoppers were warned to keep alert for â€œany signs of tampering, especially scuff marks or scratches near the bar code,â€ when purchasing gift cards.

â€œThe Sacramento County Sheriffâ€™s Office urges residents to be cautious when purchasing physical gift cards from any retailer,â€ the sheriffâ€™s office said. â€œThese operations are very sophisticated, and modifications to the gift cards are often virtually undetectable, even to the trained eye.

â€œDetectives suspect Sun has done this at many stores and are requesting the publicâ€™s help to potentially link him to other crimes.â€

4 The operation spanned across California and several regions nationwide. Facebook/Sacramento County Sheriffâ€™s Office

Authorities are still investigating Sun and his alleged crimes.

Retail theft crimes in California have continued rising in recent years. Sacramento County Sheriff Jim Cooper told Fox News Digital in an interview last month crime is â€œway beyond crisis level,â€ while pinning the blame on Proposition 47.

Voters approved Prop 47 through a ballot initiative in 2014, which lowered shoplifting charges for thefts of $950 or less from felonies to misdemeanors.

Cooper is calling for a new ballot initiative to change California laws that â€œincentivize criminal behavior.â€

â€œRetailers need to step up and make safety in their stores a priority. Bad laws that incentivize criminal behavior need to change, and only you, the voters, can make that happen. Iâ€™ve seen the polls. It will pass overwhelmingly if put on the ballot. Retailers, step up and fund the initiative,â€ Cooper said in a video spotlighting Operation Bad Elf this week.

Title: â€˜SNLâ€™ swings and misses with cold open attempting to skewer antisemitism hearings hours after UPenn President Liz Magill resigns: â€˜Abysmalâ€™
Content(RAW):
Viewers blasted â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€™sâ€ cold opener after the show mocked this weekâ€™s congressional hearings on antisemitism on college campuses â€” hours after University of Pennsylvania President Liz Magill resigned amid a flurry of backlash over her testimony.

The opening sketch, set up as a C-SPAN broadcast, tried to poke fun at the presidents of Harvard, UPenn and MIT â€” portrayed by Ego Nwodim, Heidi Gardner and Chloe Fineman, respectively â€” as they testified before the House Education Committee.

There were few laughs to be heard from the audience.

Viewers took to social media to slam the sketch, which some saw as undermining the seriousness of incidents of antisemitism on college campuses in recent weeks since Israelâ€™s war with Hamas began on Oct. 7.

Others thought it was just flat-out bad.

6 Chloe Troast (L) portrayed Rep. Elise Stefanik in the cold opener that poked fun at the recent congressional hearings on antisemitism on college campuses. SNL/NBC

Newcomer Chloe Troast played Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-NY), an outspoken Donald Trump supporter, and targeted her line of questioning during the hearing as the butt of the sketch.

â€œIâ€™m going to start yelling questions at these women like Billy Eichner,â€ she says.

Stay on top of news out of the Israel-Hamas war and the global surge in antisemitism with The Postâ€™s Israel War Update, delivered right to your inbox every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

â€œAntisemitism â€” yay or nay?â€ she screams at the three women. â€œYes or no! Is calling for the genocide of Jews against the code of conduct for Harvard?â€

â€œWell, it depends on the context,â€ answers Nwodimâ€™s Dr. Claudine Gay, the president of Harvard.

6 Ego Nwodim played the president of Harvard, Dr. Claudine Gay. SNL/NBC

â€œWhat? That canâ€™t be your answer,â€ Troastâ€™s Stefanik shoots back.

â€œUPenn lady, same question, yes or no?â€ she asks Gardnerâ€™s Magill.

â€œWell, we are serious about stopping all forms of hatred, anti-semitism, Islamophobia,â€ she answers. Stefanik then poses the same question to Finemanâ€™s Dr. Sally Kornbluth, president of MIT.

â€œIf you donâ€™t say yes, youâ€™re going to make me look good, which is really, really hard to do,â€ Troastâ€™s Stefanik says. â€œSo I will ask you straight up. Do you think genocide is bad?â€

Finemanâ€™s Kornbluth responds: â€œCould I submit an answer in writing at a later date?â€

6 Chloe Fineman took on the role of president of MIT, Dr. Sally Kornbluth. SNL/NBC

â€œAm I winning this hearing?â€ an incredulous Stefanik says. â€œSomebody pinch me!â€

The three presidents breathe a sigh of relief when Stefanik learns her time is up, but another member of the committee yields their time back to her, giving her another chance to speak.

â€œI am here today because hate speech has no place on college campuses. Hate speech belongs in Congress, on Elon Muskâ€™s Twitter, at private dinners with my donors and in public speeches by my work husband, Donald Trump,â€ Troastâ€™s Stefanik says.

The sketch also ridiculed the vague, evasive answers from the academic leaders.

6 Heidi Gardner portrayed University of Pennsylvania President Liz Magill. SNL/NBC

â€œOnly a hate-filled, anti-Semitic SNL could do a sketch about the anti-Semitic college presidents testifying in front of Congress and make the questioner Congresswoman Stefanik the target of the sketch,â€ radio host Mark Simone tweeted.

â€œRather remarkable how few laughs there were in #SNLâ€™s Cold Open. They â€“ oddly â€“ tried to skewer Elise Stefanik (who by all accounts won the day) as shrill. I guess I was under the misapprehension that calling a woman â€œshrillâ€ was sexist,â€ one X user posted.

â€œThe worst cold open on SNL Iâ€™ve ever seen the audience was barely laughing,â€ another wrote.

6 Kenan Thompson appeared as the president of the online University of Phoenix. SNL/NBC

â€œGotta be the worst cold open Iâ€™ve ever seen on SNL absolutely abysmal,â€ another said.

Another user remarked: â€œSNL is taking a big swing in the cold open and it looks like itâ€™s going to be a missâ€¦â€

While largely falling flat, the sketch was somewhat saved by an appearance from show veteran Kenan Thompson, who played the president of the online University of Phoenix.

â€œCan you take a moral stance on anything? Can anyone here say yes to a single question?â€ Troastâ€™s Stefanik shouts.

6 Following the cold opening, people online went after the decades-long sketch show about poking fun at antisemitism on college campuses. SNL/NBC

â€œI am willing to say yes to anything,â€ Thompson says.

â€œSee, see, finally. A real president of a real university,â€ Stefanik answers.

â€œThatâ€™s actually our school motto: U of P: We are a real university,â€ he answers.

Her Stefanik asks if he would promise to eliminate antisemitism from the schoolâ€™s campus.

â€œMy campus is the internet. Antisemitism is kind of our most popular major, and our mascot is porn,â€ Thompson quipped.

The real Stefanik, meanwhile, gave a scorching response when news of Magillâ€™s resignation broke.

â€œOne down. Two to go,â€ the congresswoman posted on X.

Title: Ohio city denies desperate copâ€™s $10K offer to keep beloved K-9 partner: â€˜Been with us through everythingâ€™
Content(RAW):
A former K-9 officer is fighting tooth and nail to retire his longtime partner and formally fold him into his family â€” but an Ohio city is standing in the way.

Officer Chad Hagan claims the city of Shaker Heights rebuffed his offer of $10,000 to take canine Igor with him when he leaves the department purely out of spite, knowing that the separation would be devastating for both.

The pair have worked together for more than five years, during which time they have formed an unbreakable, familial bond.

â€œHeâ€™s been with us through our first home, our forever home, marriage, having a baby. Been with us through everything,â€ Haganâ€™s wife, Danielle, told Cleveland19.

â€œWeâ€™re his only family that he knows.â€

The heartbreaking saga began in September when Hagan told his superiors out of respect that he would be looking for job opportunities to move closer to his family, a decision the chief reportedly applauded.

Although Hagan had no job opportunities at the time, Chief Wayne Hudson decided to rip the German shepherd apart from his longtime handler so the K-9 could acclimate to a new officer, according to an online petition.

5 Officer Chad Hagan and his K9 Igor have worked together for more than five years, during which time they have formed an unbreakable, familial bond. Facebook

When Hagan pressed to adopt Igor instead, Hudson allegedly insinuated that he would approve the offer if the pair continued to work in Shaker Heights for another two years.

The desperate handler argued the beloved 6-and-a-half-year-old pooch was nearing retirement and offered to buy him for $10,000 â€” when the usual price for buying a retired K-9 is $1 â€” but was briskly shot down.

â€œThis offer was denied, due to a clear act of spite. Chief Hudson stated, â€˜it (K9 Igor) is a tool and there is no financial amount that would be considered,'â€ the petition alleges.

5 Chief Wayne Hudson is refusing to let the officer buy out the K9. YouTube/19 News

Despite the scathing comments, Hudson allegedly left the meeting by giving Hagan a sense of hope that his mind could be changed.

When Hagan handed in his resignation around Thanksgiving, however, the chief ruined the holiday by ordering the handler to return Igor to a facility.

5 A former Ohio city K-9 officer is fighting to keep his longtime K9 partner on the brink of retirement, but the city is standing in the way of securing his trusted companion. Change.org

â€œIgor is a six-year-old German Shepard and, if his health remains strong, he is expected to be fit for duty, keeping the residents of Shaker Heights safe, for another three or four years. He shows no signs of slowing down,â€ the city told Ceveland19 in a statement.

5 The desperate handler argued the beloved 6-and-a-half-year-old pooch was nearing retirement and offered to buy him for $10,000. Facebook

Officials asserted that neither Hudson nor the cityâ€™s administration have the authority to sell Igor considering his fitness levels.

Other than hoping to retire Igor out of love, the Hagan family argued Igor has slowed down in recent years, estimating he only has a year or two of law enforcement left.

Danielle also claims other nearby communities have let officers purchase canines even after four years for just $1.

5 The Hagan family is the only family K-9 Igor has ever known, a petition read. Facebook

â€œThe Hagan family is the only family K-9 Igor has ever known and instead of being with Officer Hagan and his family for the remaining week and a half, he has been living in a boarding facility, laying on a 4Ã—4 concrete pad because of the retaliation by Chief Hudson,â€ the petition states.

â€œThe bond that Officer Hagan and K-9 Igor have is beyond what anyone could ever imagine. K-9 Igor has saved Officer Haganâ€™s life on multiple occasions. K-9 Igor is not a â€˜tool.â€™ He is a beloved member of the Hagan family and Officer Haganâ€™s best friend. This is truly the worst heartbreak this family has ever been through.â€

Title: YouTuber, dad killed in plane crash 1 month after â€˜aircraft malfunctionâ€™ close call
Content(RAW):
A popular aviation YouTuber and her father were killed when their plane crashed in Tennessee Thursday â€” just one month after she posted a video of her facing an â€œaircraft malfunctionâ€ at 4,000 feet.

Jenny Blalock, 45, and her father James, 78, went down around 11 a.m. and crashed on a remote road in Pulaski, a city on the central-southern border of Alabama, according to federal and county officials.

Their bodies were discovered outside the plane, which landed in a â€œremoteâ€ area that was difficult for crews to reach.

â€œIt was just devastating. It was significant damage again. Unfortunately, there were just no survivors,â€ Bill Myers, director of the Giles County Office of Emergency Management, told 10 News.

The father-and-daughter pair had traveled 180 miles from Knoxville when the aircraft plummeted, FlightAware data shows. They were roughly 10 miles short of landing at a city-owned airport.

7 Jenny Blalock, 45, and James Blalock, 78, have been identified as the two victims killed in a single-engine airplane crash in Tennessee on Thursday. 865flygirl/Instagram
